methodology: Conservative estimate from developer productivity research + Stack Overflow community data

rationale: 2024 research shows 5-30% of dev time on refactoring (20% typical)
Combined effort: 15-60+ min/file depending on complexity
human_baseline.note: Using 20 min/file for moderate complexity (105 files avg 5.6 violations each)

honest_caveats: Human baseline is estimated (not measured with real developer)
Used conservative 20 min/file (could be 10-35 depending on complexity)
Machine detects violations but doesn't fix them (detection-only comparison)
Would ideally want blinded human evaluation on same 20 files
scientific_validity: Strong for detection capability; would strengthen with measured human timing

sources: 2024 developer productivity research (5-30% time on refactoring)
Stack Overflow community data (15-60 min/file estimates)
Industry standard: 20% dev time on refactoring considered reasonable
